messages.subject: Re: New to the board
messages.msgSnippet: ... is ... Hi Richard Welcome to the group. I live in Sydney and am also a huge Nihonto fanatic. Actually I love all kinds of swords, weather it is Japanese,
messages.messageBody:
--- In samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com, "Richard Turner"
<ikkanshi@w...> wrote:
> Hi all, I am new to this board and thought I would say hi. My name
is
> Richard Turner and I live in Perth, Western Australia and am a
> Nihonto enthusiest.

Hi Richard
Welcome to the group. I live in Sydney and am also a huge
Nihonto fanatic. Actually I love all kinds of swords, weather it is
Japanese, France, and Chinese etc. The people hear are full of
interesting information and always willing to help. I hope to share
information on all manners of topics with your-self especially on my
favoured subject the Japanese Sword.

Tom
Try and cut the address for the Katana and past it into word or
something then place the curser after the "k" so it says "Kotto0120",
now cut and past in the browser. Should look something like

1094281515tukabukuro.iti.jpg

messages.messageBody:
Hi Jay, thanks for the information. Just on a technical note, I am
receiving bit of email in your response such as (伊東) is this
Kanji ?, I have my Kanji settings on, maybe it is something else ?.

best wishes

Rich

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] New to the board
messages.msgSnippet: Oyakata holds session: ... Hi! Welcome to the list - you ll find a lot of really knowledgable folks here. ... This is indeed an ume-bachi mon, which appears to
messages.messageBody:
Oyakata holds session:
On Mon, 13 Sep 2004 22:34:50 -0000, Richard Turnerさん wrote:
>Hi all, I am new to this board and thought I would say hi. My name is
>Richard Turner and I live in Perth, Western Australia and am a

Hi! Welcome to the list - you'll find a lot of really knowledgable
folks here.

>Just for interest, I would like to confirm a Mon. I have a Fuchi
>Kashira with the Fuchi having a mon on each side. One is the Meada
>mon, the other I think is the Iori-Mokk�mon.


>Maeda mon
>http://members.westnet.com.au/whiz/richard/pics/mon-fk-2.jpg

This is indeed an ume-bachi mon, which appears to be the version
used by Maeda Toshiie. There were a few variations with
very slight differences so it's hard to be 100% sure it's the Maeda
version - but it's a good bet.


>Iori-Mokk�mon ?
>http://members.westnet.com.au/whiz/richard/pics/mon-fk-1.jpg

I concur again - it's an Iori Mokkou, usually used by the Itoh (伊東)
though also by the Itoh (伊藤).

--
Jay Kelly
oyakata@...

messages.subject: New to the board
messages.msgSnippet: Hi all, I am new to this board and thought I would say hi. My name is Richard Turner and I live in Perth, Western Australia and am a Nihonto enthusiest. I am
messages.messageBody:
Hi all, I am new to this board and thought I would say hi. My name is
Richard Turner and I live in Perth, Western Australia and am a
Nihonto enthusiest. I am looking forward to reading lots of good info
on smaurai here, a freind put me onto this with a copy of a recent
thread on the film the Twilight Samurai, one of my favorite recent
movies.

Just for interest, I would like to confirm a Mon. I have a Fuchi
Kashira with the Fuchi having a mon on each side. One is the Meada
mon, the other I think is the Iori-Mokkô mon.


Maeda mon
http://members.westnet.com.au/whiz/richard/pics/mon-fk-2.jpg

Iori-Mokkô mon ?
http://members.westnet.com.au/whiz/richard/pics/mon-fk-1.jpg

These Katana Zutsu are also on some interest.
http://img147.auctions.yahoo.co.jp/users/5/1/7/5/k
otto0120-img600x450-1094281515tukabukuro.iti.jpg

Anyway, thnaks for the band width.

Cheers

Rich Turner
